job_description:
Flatbed trucking company searching for Owner Operators. Come join a great home where you are known by name and not just your truck number. Yes, we are based in Nevada but our hiring process is 100% remote and you will complete our online orientation before receiving operating equipment in the mail.

Our Hotshot drivers often earn more than big rig drivers of other companies. With an industry low lease rate of 20%, we are confident that Owner Operators will find this opportunity to be lucrative.

• Solo driver

• CDL A (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

job_title: Remote -Hot and urgent requirement of SharePoint Power Apps Developer
job_description:
SharePoint Power Apps Developer

8+ Months Contract

Remote Work: Candidate must report to Harrisburg to receive issued equipment. Candidate must go through CJIS certification in addition to the normal Patch check.

Experience Required
• Experience with Microsoft Power Pages
• Microsoft Power Apps
• Microsoft Power Automate
• SharePoint Online (Site collections, sites, lists, libraries, pages, permissions, etc.)
• Microsoft Office Desktop Applications including Microsoft Teams
• Microsoft Power BI
• Project management
• Business analysis

Job Responsibilities
• Design, build, test, and deploy web-based, out-of-the-box Power Platform solutions that address Commonwealth of Pennsylvania business needs/objectives by architecting and developing solutions using SharePoint Online, Power Apps, Power Pages, and Power Automate. Work will focus on the creation of Power Pages and Power Apps but may also include the creation of custom sites, lists, libraries, content types, web parts, forms, views, notifications, and/or workflows using the Microsoft Power Platform suite of tools as well as testing and documenting created applications.
• Evaluate business requirements to create estimates for time and resources needed to create Power Platform solutions.
• Work with Business Analysts and Business Stake Holders to document business requirements, specifications, procedures, and training materials.
• Support existing Power Apps, Power Pages, and Power Automates with changing and evolving needs through working with Business Analysts and Business Stake Holders.

Regards

223-234-1750

Qualifications: Candidate must go through CJIS certification in addition to the normal Patch check
Experience with Microsoft Power Pages
Microsoft Power Apps
Microsoft Power Automate
SharePoint Online (Site collections, sites, lists, libraries, pages, permissions, etc.)
Microsoft Office Desktop Applications including Microsoft Teams
Microsoft Power BI
Project management
Business analysis
Responsibilities: Design, build, test, and deploy web-based, out-of-the-box Power Platform solutions that address Commonwealth of Pennsylvania business needs/objectives by architecting and developing solutions using SharePoint Online, Power Apps, Power Pages, and Power Automate

Work will focus on the creation of Power Pages and Power Apps but may also include the creation of custom sites, lists, libraries, content types, web parts, forms, views, notifications, and/or workflows using the Microsoft Power Platform suite of tools as well as testing and documenting created applications

Work with Business Analysts and Business Stake Holders to document business requirements, specifications, procedures, and training materials
Support existing Power Apps, Power Pages, and Power Automates with changing and evolving needs through working with Business Analysts and Business Stake Holders

Maxim Healthcare Staffing is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. job_description:
Green Valley Trucking is looking for over the road Hotshot truck drivers that have their own equipmen. We are looking for dependable and reliable people only. Someone who is very accountable and pays extreme attention to detail. We focus on hauling automobiles and trailers. You will be responsible for making sure all loads are secure and that no damages occur. We pay weekly with a 1099 given at year-end. We are looking for owner operators to lease onto our authority. Owner Operators are responsible for paying insurance, fuel, maintenanc, etc. We provide expert guidance and direction for the beginner and all the support needed for the expert

Requirements:
- Valid class A driver’s license and clean driving record (no tickets or accidents)
- Excellent time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
- Strong communication skills to interact with customers and team members
- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

• Owner-operator

Trucking home time:
• Home weekly

• OTR
• Regional

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

• CDL A (Required)

job_title: Hot and urgent requirement of Senior Program Manager- Harrisburg, PA - Remote  10 Months Contract
job_description:
Senior Program Manager/SPM1 A4 SC3

Harrisburg, PA - Remote 10 Months Contract

This contractor role leads and manages the ongoing implementation and continuing development of the MyOMHSAS enterprise learning management system (eLMS). The incumbent must have the education and experience to oversee both project management and technical development of an eLMS. This work requires knowledge of eLMS related software including, but not limited to Moodle, SCORM, AICC, Storyline, Captivate, Articulate, Presenter, Photoshop, and similar technologies. This position requires the education and experience to oversee and actively engage in project management, curriculum development, and instructional design elements of an eLMS.

The contractor in this position reports to OMHSAS staff and entails highly independent professional work that involves the identification, coordination, and implementation of adult learning content and resources delivered via the MyOMHSAS platform. The contractor's primary responsibilities will be to provide highest level senior technical and programmatic support to OMHSAS staff responsible for overseeing the implementation and ongoing maintenance of MyOMHSAS. This system is hosted by the University of Massachusetts, Chan Medical School (UMass). The MyOMHSAS platform uses existing architecture developed by UMass for the Office of Developmental Programs (ODP) for its eLMS referred to as MyODP and is based on Moodle framework.

The incumbent must have proven leadership and project management experience in conjunction with knowledge of and experience implementing adult learning interventions using the analyze, develop, design, implement, and evaluate (ADDIE) model of adult learning and curriculum development. Work will be assigned by the appropriate OMHSAS manager, performed independently with initiative and in cooperation and coordination with subject matter experts (SME) and stakeholders, and reviewed upon completion. This position also provides senior technical support and mentoring for other team members including OMHSAS staff from a variety of bureaus and program areas.

Exmples Of Job Duties

Specific tasks for the contractor are:

Manages relationships with UMass and ODP to support ongoing development of the MyOMHSAS resource.

Partners with UMass to manage the day-to-day administration of all system needs, including, but not limited to content updates and bug/enhancement solutioning.

Works with internal partners and external vendors to maintain and improve training content and resources to align with OMHSAS needs.

Creates and manages the overall course structure and sets up courses utilizing instructional design techniques/modalities to ensure maximum learner retention and training content provided through MyOMHSAS in coordination with subject matter experts (SME).

Provides project management for course development, coordinating the ongoing expansion and enhancement of MyOMHSAS in partnership with OMHSAS staff and external SMEs including contracted vendors, service providers, and educational institutions.

Builds customized certifications related to training content and course offerings.

Creates and conducts assessments and evaluations for MyOMHSAS course offerings, including soliciting feedback from learners, stakeholders, SMEs, and OMHSAS staff.

Monitors trends to identify opportunities for improvement and makes recommendations that can be initiated for improved outcomes.

Provides reports on MyOMHSAS usage to OMHSAS management staff.

Effectively communicates verbally and in writing with all stakeholders.

Responds promptly and accurately to inquiries regarding program or project information.

Creates user guides, promotional materials, and other resources related to MyOMHSAS and its training catalog to increase awareness of the resource and ensure targeted stakeholders have knowledge of appropriate trainings.

Creates and manages the overall course structure and sets up courses utilizing instructional design techniques/modalities to ensure maximum learner retention and training content provided by OMHSAS or SMEs.

DELIVERABLES

Specific Deliverables For The Contractor Are

Implement the ADDIE model of adult learning content development though both synchronous and asynchronous online training modalities analyze, design, develop, implement, and evaluate.

Conduct needs assessments in collaboration with program office representatives across OMHSAS and other DHS offices, including internal and external subject-matter-experts and stakeholders.

Organize and lead planning sessions that identify suitable training and development approaches, including types of learning and conditions of learning, to suitably address training and learning gaps identified by assessment efforts.

Identify low-cost/no-cost solutions available through existing and emerging stakeholder partnerships (i.e. UPenn, Drexel, Temple, E4 Center, etc.) that can meet OMHSAS needs, or determine whether specific content must be developed to meet the identified needs.

Design and develop interactive e-learning content using Articulate360 and similar software for initial pilot delivery and revision in conjunction with deployment to the MyOMHSAS platform that relies on a Moodle framework, while soliciting and incorporating feedback from the program office, subject matter experts, and other stakeholders.

Ensure content meets or exceeds DHS/OMHSAS diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) principles and guidelines established by the DHS Learning Governance Committee, and work with stakeholders to revise or adjust content to promote DEI approaches reflective of belonging and inclusivity.

Coordinate testing and implementation of e-learning modules (SCORM) in conjunction with UMass to deploy content to the production e-learning environment.

Employ the Kirkpatrick model of curriculum evaluation to measure and analyze the efficacy of training content and to assess short-term and long-term results (return on investment) of training content Level 1 (reaction), Level 2 (learning), Level 3 (behavior), and Level 4 (results).

Periodically report assessment and evaluation results to inform OMHSAS of emerging needs, trends, patterns, and other information that serves to maintain awareness of current and future e-learning needs.

Contractor Skills And Experience Requirements

The contractor in this role must have the education and experience to oversee both project management and technical development of an eLMS. Leading and managing the ongoing development of MyOMHSAS and its training and resource offerings requires knowledge and understanding of eLMS-related software and platform resources including but not limited to Moodle, SCORM, AICC, Storyline, Captivate, Articulate, Presenter, Photoshop, and similar technologies.

The incumbent must have proven leadership and project management experience in conjunction with knowledge of and experience implementing adult learning interventions using the analyze, develop, design, implement, and evaluate (ADDIE) model of adult learning curriculum development. Work will be assigned by the appropriate OMHSAS manager, performed independently with initiative and in cooperation and coordination with subject matter experts (SME) and stakeholders, and reviewed upon completion. This position also provides senior technical support and mentoring for other team members including OMHSAS staff from a variety of bureaus and program areas.

The vendor will supply a consultant who does not require training and who has experience with the referenced human resource development interventions and technologies. The consultant, and vendor, must be able to exchange information constructively among all levels of DHS and OMHSAS stakeholders from executive management to end-users.

Specific Skills And Experience Include

A master's degree with post-secondary education instruction experience or corporate training experience is strongly preferred, with additional education and experience to related to project management, adult learning principles and interventions, and technical enhancement of an asynchronous online eLMS platform.

Familiarity with public administration and delivery of mental health or human services.

Understanding of modern web development practices such as user interface accessibility, compliance with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (CWOPA) requirements related to web security and procedures, and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) principles that result in efficient, compliant, and effective user experiences.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Passion for instructional design, curriculum development, positive user experiences, and outstanding customer service.

Understanding of adult learning principles including the ADDIE model of adult learning curriculum development.

Effective negotiation and coordination skills when collaborating with stakeholders and SMEs to identify learning needs, explore appropriate learning interventions, and develop learning solutions that meet DHS/OMHSAS needs.

Regards,

Ravi 223-234-1750

Qualifications: This position requires the education and experience to oversee and actively engage in project management, curriculum development, and instructional design elements of an eLMS

The incumbent must have proven leadership and project management experience in conjunction with knowledge of and experience implementing adult learning interventions using the analyze, develop, design, implement, and evaluate (ADDIE) model of adult learning and curriculum development
The contractor in this role must have the education and experience to oversee both project management and technical development of an eLMS

Leading and managing the ongoing development of MyOMHSAS and its training and resource offerings requires knowledge and understanding of eLMS-related software and platform resources including but not limited to Moodle, SCORM, AICC, Storyline, Captivate, Articulate, Presenter, Photoshop, and similar technologies
Familiarity with public administration and delivery of mental health or human services

Understanding of modern web development practices such as user interface accessibility, compliance with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (CWOPA) requirements related to web security and procedures, and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) principles that result in efficient, compliant, and effective user experiences
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Passion for instructional design, curriculum development, positive user experiences, and outstanding customer service

job_title: Local Haul CDL Truck Driver, Hot Springs, Arkansas
job_description:
Local Haul CDL Truck Driver, Hot Springs, AR
• *Local Haul CDL Truck Driver, Hot Springs, AR**
• *Local Haul CDL Truck Driver**
• *Hot Springs, Arkansas** Day and night shifts available. Schedule may include weekends.

Drivers report to their managers in Prescott, Arkansas.
• *Truck Drivers**

Do you want **great pay** and to **be home every day**
• *At HTI, you can have it all.**

We ensure our drivers are **home daily.**

$5,000 Sign On Bonus Your HTI recruiter has details.
• *HTI Chip Haul Drivers are Home Daily**
• *Driver Qualifications**

Must be at least 22 years of age.

Valid CDL-A License, issued by the state in which you reside.

Must be able to pass a D.O.T. Medical Exam performed by a company approved physician.

Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen.

One year tractor-trailer experience within the last three years.

Insurance

+ Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance (company paid)

Shirt, Jacket, Cap program

Years of service awards

HTI employees receive an attractive gold ring after 15 years of service and a diamond for each year thereafter.

Driver Bonuses

+ Up to $5,000 sign-on bonus for new drivers (*Conditions apply, call for details.*)

+ Performance Incentive Bonus

+ Safety Bonus

+ Fuel Bonus

+ Retention pay for Years of Service

+ Recruiting Referral Bonus

+ Driver-of-the-Month Bonus

+ Driver-of-the-Year Bonus
• Please call 870.887.9402 or 601.996.6362 if you have any questions about postions available.*
• J.D. and Billy Hines Trucking, Inc. (HTI) is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

job_description:
Call or Text (817) 675-6417

Mabe Transport is looking for dedicated hot shot owner operators to lease under our authority. We have a very high demand for trucks to run our customers loads!

This is not a company driver job, you must have your own truck and trailer!

Tired of getting screwed over by these mom and pop lease on companies? Start today and receive a $1,000 cash sign on bonus!

We Provide
- The DOT / MC Authority
- We cover the commercial insurance
- Fuel card is provided
- Weekly pay
- Cash advances
- Dedicated lanes
- We even dispatch you!
- $5,000 to $8,000 a week in gross!

Requirments
- 30ft flatbed trailer (minimum) anything less will be rejected
- Diesel truck
- Willing to work and stay out on the road for at least a week at a time
- The desire to make money!

Call or Text (817) 675-6417

GET ON THE ROAD AS SOON AS TOMORROW!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $5,000.00 - $10,000.00 per week

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid time off
• Referral program
• Vision insurance

Supplemental pay types:
• Detention pay
• Extra stop pay
• Layover pay
• Safety bonus
• Signing bonus
• Tarp pay

• Owner-operator
• Solo driver
• Team driver

Trucking home time:
• Home weekly

Trucking route:
• Dedicated
• OTR
• Regional

• Year / Make / Model of your truck?
• What size trailer do you have? (MUST BE 30FT OR LONGER)
• Best number to call you at?
• When do you want to hit the road?

Work Location: On the road

Qualifications: 30ft flatbed trailer (minimum) anything less will be rejected
Diesel truck
Willing to work and stay out on the road for at least a week at a time
The desire to make money!
(MUST BE 30FT OR LONGER)
Benefits: Start today and receive a $1,000 cash sign on bonus!
